intro: Asperula lilaciflora subsp. mutensis, commonly known as the purple honeysuckle, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It features small, fragrant, lilac-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has dark green, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
